Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery dinos; interior glazed black; exterior: from top, part of painted decoration consisting possibly of a foot; narrow black band; black-figure decoration consisting of animal and siren to left (of animal, tail and part of rump remaining; of siren, face and chest).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Ghost of lost label on inside.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 41, pl. XX, no. 35)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 289, no. B266)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1192)
